In the consumer space, some of the most prominent apps that will perform better with a GPU include:

1. Gaming: Games that require intensive graphics processing such as first-person shooters, racing games, and open-world games will perform better with a GPU.
2. Video Editing and Creation: Video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, and DaVinci Resolve will benefit from a GPU's parallel processing capabilities.
3. 3D Modeling and Animation: 3D modeling and animation software such as Autodesk 3ds Max, Blender, and Maya will perform better with a GPU, especially for tasks such as rendering and simulations.
4. Photo Editing: Photo editing software such as Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom, and GIMP can take advantage of a GPU's parallel processing capabilities to speed up tasks such as image manipulation, color correction, and effects.
5. Scientific simulations: Scientific simulations, such as weather forecasting, computational fluid dynamics, and molecular dynamics, will perform better with a GPU due to the ability to perform complex calculations quickly.
6. Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning: AI and ML applications, such as computer vision, natural language processing, and deep learning, will perform better with a GPU, as they are designed to take advantage of a GPU's parallel processing capabilities.
